data.text: @Curious_Sarah_ Why don't you research outside of the #Government Propaganda and find out about the thousands of people who are #Jab injured?  Also, it is the constitutional right of each and every citizen to protest.  And objecting to #MedicalTyranny is an ENTIRELY valid reason to protest.

@CryptoGrimmer … and there is a big difference between being socio-economically poor and so poor you literally can’t afford to buy food.
Now bugger off, I’ll get sacked. 😊

@CryptoGrimmer Haha! 😁 No, no, it’s not always a choice. It could be as a result of a lot of things. Mental health and eating disorders to name but two. Christ, I’ve been down the overeating because of low mood path…
@Curious_Sarah_ Have a good day me as well lol :)

@Curious_Sarah_ I’m sorry but that is not true, you don’t need vegetables to be skinny/fit. It is ALWAYS someone’s choice to be obese, there is no excuse to over eat junk. There are no obese people in extremely poor places that isn’t by choice. And I agree I still love you :)
@CryptoGrimmer ... and now I need to go back to work!
@CryptoGrimmer I'll join you on that protest!) but don't demonise ordinary people. We turn on each other (as the world is doing right now 😢) we stand no chance. 4/4

@CryptoGrimmer So not only has Covid picked off the unhealthy ones is also made a beeline for the ones with not much cash! Sure, please do be angry at big business and right wing governments for screwing everyone over. 3/4

@CryptoGrimmer There is a very strong relationship between obesity and low socioeconomic status. Vegetables ain't cheap! (Especially if you live in New Zealand! 😮) But junk is. And if you're poor you're less likely to live somewhere green or have a gym membership. 2/4
